intro: Eremogone pungens, commonly known as the sharpleaf eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers appear in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
